election_record.label: New York 1822 Governor

overview.note: In the 1822 election, the Ballston Spa Gazette (Ballston Spa, NY) used the name 'Freeman's Meeting Ticket' to denote the Clintonian/Federalist.

sub_unit.name: Six
sub_unit.note: "For Governor, Lieutenant Governor, and Senators there were thirteen scattering votes." National Advocate (New York, NY). November 15, 1822.

sub_unit.name: Wallkill
sub_unit.note: Solomon Southwick received 1 vote as S. Southwick.

sub_unit.name: Albany
sub_unit.note: Joseph C. Yates received 1 vote as J. C. Yates and 4 votes as Joseph Yates.
Solomon Southwick received 2 votes as S. Southwick, 1 vote as Sol Southwick and 1 vote as Solomon South.

sub_unit.name: Schenectady
sub_unit.note: Totals for Schenectady County include the returns from the town of Niskayuna, which were not counted in the Official Canvass.

sub_unit.name: Essex
sub_unit.note: Joseph C. Yates received 1 vote as Joseph Yates.

sub_unit.name: Franklin
sub_unit.note: Joseph C. Yates received 8 votes as Joseph Yates.

The initial reports for Franklin County only gave the returns from four towns, which were not named. Those totals were given as: Joseph C. Yates 562 votes, Solomon Southwick 1 vote. When the Official Returns were reported, it was noted that 'The votes of Dickinson and Bangor were lost.' It appears, based on the first partial reports that the votes from one or both of these towns were included in those results. In 1822 there were six towns in Franklin County."

sub_unit.name: Halfmoon
sub_unit.note: Joseph C. Yates received 2 votes as Joseph Yates.

sub_unit.name: Camden
sub_unit.note: The Scattering votes were not broken down by town. There were 6 scattering votes in the town of Camden.

sub_unit.name: Deerfield
sub_unit.note: The Scattering votes were not broken down by town. There were 2 scattering votes in the town of Deerfield.

sub_unit.name: Paris
sub_unit.note: The Scattering votes were not broken down by town. There were 14 scattering votes in the town of Paris.

sub_unit.name: Utica
sub_unit.note: The Scattering votes were not broken down by town. There were 9 scattering votes in the town of Utica.

sub_unit.name: Westmoreland
sub_unit.note: The Scattering votes were not broken down by town. There were 2 scattering votes in the town of Westmoreland.

sub_unit.name: Whitestown
sub_unit.note: The Scattering votes were not broken down by town. There was 1 scattering vote in the town of Whitestown.

sub_unit.name: Oswego
sub_unit.note: Joseph C. Yates received 1 vote as Joseph C. Ya and 2 votes as Joseph Yates.

sub_unit.name: Broome
sub_unit.note: The towns of Berkshire and Owego, originally taken from Tioga County in 1806 when Broome was organized, where given back to Tioga County in 1822. In April 1821, two new towns, Colesville and Sanford were organized. They were taken from the town of Windsor.

sub_unit.name: Otsego
sub_unit.note: Joseph C. Yates received 1 vote as Joseph Yates.
Solomon Southwick received 1 vote as Sol Southwick, 2 votes as S. Southwick and 1 vote as Solomon Southworth.
Two additional votes for Solomon Southwick in Otsego County were listed in the scattering votes.

sub_unit.name: Tompkins
sub_unit.note: "Election: The Inspectors of elections of the town of Ithaca, have given notice, that on Monday the 4th of November next, first day of election, the poll will be opened in the forenoon, at the house of Eseck Angel, in the north-west part of the town; and will adjourn to the house of Henry Stringer, up the inlet, where it will be held in the afternoon. On Tuesday, the second day of election - forenoon at the house of John King, on the south hill, and afternoon at the house of William D. Hammond, in the east part of town. Wednesday, the third day of election, at the Hotel in this village." Republican Chronicle (Ithaca, NY). October 30, 1822.

sub_unit.name: Dryden
sub_unit.note: Solomon Southwick received 1 vote as S. Southwick.

sub_unit.name: Ithaca
sub_unit.note: Joseph C. Yates received 1 vote as J. C. Yates.

sub_unit.name: Onondaga
sub_unit.note: Joseph C. Yates received 1 vote as Joseph Yates.
Solomon Southwick received 1 vote as S. Southwick.

sub_unit.name: Sodus
sub_unit.note: The Ontario county votes include the returns from Sodus. The returns for the town of Sodus were rejected in the official canvass, but they have been added to the state wide results.

sub_unit.name: Chautauque
sub_unit.note: Solomon Southwick received 1 vote as Solomon C. Southwick and 1 vote as Solomon S. Southwick.

sub_unit.name: Monroe
sub_unit.note: Joseph C. Yates received 1 vote as J. C. Yates.

sub_unit.name: Steuben
sub_unit.note: Solomon Southwick received 1 vote as Solomon Southward and 1 vote as S. Southwick.
